results.title: Postnatal care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Education for Childbirth”.
Shows the mother in her hospital room, doing exercises, caring for her baby, nursing etc. It discusses the father’s relation to the new situation and portrays some of the joy to be found in the new family constellation. Diagrams show how the mother’s body returns to normal.

results.title: Poster
results.creator_credit: Bailey Film Productions and Durrell R. Crays
results.brief_description: A poster sells a product or an idea. It has a single concept; it must be an instant visual communication to impress and motivate the viewer to act on the message. The greatest change in posters is movement - commercials on television are posters in motion. Shows numerous examples of traditional and modern posters.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bailey Film Productions and Durrell R. Crays

results.title: Post script to empire
results.brief_description: Tells the story of two places, the Isle of Dogs region of London and the recently-built town of Stevenage 30 miles away, the old and the new. Shows Britain trying to come to terms with a world far different from that which it knew before World War II.

results.title: Post partum depression
results.brief_description: Two couples discuss their experience with, and feelings about, post natal depressions and the way they were able to overcome the problem with the aid of a post partum counselling group.

results.title: Post operative care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Describes how to make an anaesthetic bed and how to put a patient in bed after an operation with minimal movement. Describes how a patient must be watched and every reaction noted while regaining consciousness.

results.title: Post-Impressionists
results.creator_credit: Egons Tomsons, International Film Bureau and George Barford
results.brief_description: Surveys the aims, influences and techniques of Cezanne, Gauguin, Van Gogh, Seurat, and Toulouse-Lautrec. Indicates how the experiments and work of these artists led to different movements in modern painting.

results.title: Possessions (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Ways of seeing”.
One of a series of films by the distinguished art critic and author, John Berger, in which he explores the ways in which we look at pictures. Berger argues that paintings were, and still are, the most valuable single objects which we can possess.

results.title: Possessions
results.creator_credit: Michael Dibb and TAFE National Video Resource Centre (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Ways of seeing”.
One of a series of films by art critic and author John Berger, which explores the ways in which we look at pictures. John Berger believes we have misunderstood the real meaning of European oil painting because we are normally encouraged to look at only a few exceptional works instead of the hundreds of thousands of unremakable pictures which make up the main tradition. He argues that this still continues today in the modern medium of advertising and publicity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Dibb and TAFE National Video Resource Centre (Australia)

results.title: Positioning for Function Workshop
results.brief_description: Seating and positioning for handicapped clients is thoroughly examined in this video and careful attention is given to designing equipment which meets, as fully as is possible, the individual needs. Such attention to design assists in maximising function.

results.title: Portugal
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
A general picture of the Republic of Portugal. Presents Portugal as an example of Catholic social and economic policy. Shows the corporate organization of its society, under dictator Salazar. Gives glimpses of Portugal’s chief exports (Port wine, cork) and its fishing and farming - the greater part of the economy. Shows the education system, which is geared to social stability and respect for the past.
